paoil93.briefly: Still Life of Fruit and Flowers with a Parrot, on a Table covered with a Green Cloth
paoil93.title: Still Life (Parrot, Fruit and Still Life)
paoil93.acquisition_note: Provenance - recorded in Towneley painting catalogue of July 1861 "In Antique Bedroom - 103bis - Oil painting of Parrot, Fruit and Still Life". It apparently remained in the wainscot over the fireplace after purchase of the Hall in November 1901, but was not catalogued as part of the Museum collection before 1933. Wilfred Dean, in his first report as Honorary Secretary in May 1934, stated that "an exceedingly fine oil painting, 'Still Life' by De Heem, which was fixed over the fireplace in No. V Room off the Long Gallery when the Hall was taken over by the Corporation, has been restored and framed ... and hung in the Dining Room". [See also Council Minutes 3293 (h) 12th October 1933]
paoil93.dimensions: picture : width x height : 36 x 50 inches
paoil93.document_note: N.I.R.P. Research Report for Towneley Hall by Lisa Howard 25.1.2007
paoil93.bridgeman_note: artist recorded as Heem, Jan Davidsz. de (1606-84); THA 100412 = Still Life of Fruit and Flowers, detail of a Parrot

paoil265.title: Entrance to Towneley Park by Moonlight
paoil265.dimensions: picture : width x height : 30 x 20 inches
paoil265.production_note: This painting and paoil337 are by the same artist, possibly Ralph Green. He exhibited regularly as a local artist at Towneley from 1905 until 1939, mainly landscapes with local buildings as the main subject. A painting of his with the title "Towneley Holmes" was exhibited in 1926 and may be paoil265. This is a cropped version of paoil337, which itself would not have been acceptable for exhibition because the width exceeded 30". Both paintings are almost certainly based on a photograph by George Henry Foulds "Old Lodge, Towneley", published around 1900. Both photograph and paintings used the same viewpoint and include trees of the same size and position. Both paintings contain the same inaccuracies in minor details such as heights of fences chimneys, etc. .
